clinical_study.brief_title: Thrombosis Outcomes in Pediatric Venous Thromboembolism
clinical_study.official_title: Predicting and Preventing Poor Outcomes of Venous Thromboembolism in Children

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

clinical_study.source: University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center

brief_summary.textblock: 'The TOP Study' is a prospective cohort study whose main objective is to develop better prognostic biomarkers and identify children at risk of adverse thrombotic outcomes very early in the course after an initial venous thromboembolic events (VTE). The study will compare biomarkers in children that develop poor VTE outcomes (such as recurrence, postthrombotic syndrome and post PE impairment ) after an initial VTE with those that do not develop such outcomes.

detailed_description.textblock: All newly diagnosed patients with a first radiologically confirmed thrombotic event (any site) diagnosed at Children's Medical Center, Dallas will be followed prospectively with global coagulation assessment over a 24-month period, and monitored for development of carefully defined adverse VTE outcomes in a blinded manner. Biomarker assessment will include global coagulation assays (thrombin generation assay and modified thromboelastography to study fibrinolysis) at 3, 6, 12, 18 and 24 months post VTE diagnosis.

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 months after diagnosis of VTE
primary_outcome.description: PTS as assessed by the validated Manco-Johnson and the modified Villata PTS instruments determined a priori and confirmed by an endpoint adjudicating committee

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 months after diagnosis of VTE
primary_outcome.description: Recurrent VTE as assessed by ISTH proposed recurrent VTE clinical criteria

primary_outcome.time_frame: within 24 months after diagnosis of VTE
primary_outcome.description: Post-PE impairment as assessed by evidence of pulmonary hypertension/right ventricular dysfunction on echocardiography and/or impaired functional parameters on six-minute walking distance

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 months after diagnosis of VTE
secondary_outcome.description: Site specific sequelae after cerebral sinus venous, portal vein and renal vein thrombosis as assessed by ISTH recommended guidelines

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 months after diagnosis of VTE

other_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 months after diagnosis of VTE
other_outcome.description: Physical activity as determined by Gordin questionnaire

other_outcome.measure: Elastic Compression Stocking (ECS) use over time
other_outcome.time_frame: Within 24 months after diagnosis of VTE
other_outcome.description: ECS use will be assessed by ECS log/diary documenting dedicated (use for at least 6 days/week), moderate (use for 4-5 days/week) or poor use (<4 days/week)

Loss of venous access in subjects with catheter related DVT of the upper extremity DVT as defined by >30% of the narrowing of the involved vein as assessed by doppler ultrasound or contrast venography

Venous valvular reflux in subjects with lower extremity DVT will be assessed as present (>0.5 seconds) or absent (<0.5 seconds) at the 12 month post diagnosis visit with a standardized venous reflux ultrasound procedure

study_pop.textblock: Newly diagnosed patients with first venous thromboembolism who have completed therapeutic anticoagulant therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Boys and girls age birth (0 years) to equal to or less than 21 years
- A radiologically confirmed first venous thromboembolism episode (both extremity and non-extremity) who have completed anticoagulation therapy as per the 9th edition of the ACCP guidelines
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known malignancy
- Pregnancy or immediate post-partum period (12 weeks after delivery)
- Sickle cell disease
- Known bleeding disorder
